page.title: 06HOUSING IN CROUGHTON 1
page.content: Older village houses are built in Hornton stone. Although two or three old houses were built with some deference to style, most are very basic cottages which were originally thatched. An estate of council houses is situated in Wheeler's Rise, next to the Playing Fields. There are also 12 council bungalows in the Portway Estate, at the eastern edge of the village - in the main for pensioners. The whole estate of about 50 houses consists of middle price range bungalows and houses, occupied by families who are mostly integrated within the community, although they do have their own 'inner' community too - they ran a Fireworks Party last year. At the end of the Estate is a development becoming known as 'Little America', as 8 of the 10 houses are occupied by US personnel.
